item.title: Resources for Data Viz Accessibility

item.title: WAVE Audit No. 1
item.description: .page-main img { box-shadow: 0px 0px 2px 2px rgba( 0, 0, 0, 0.2 ); #/* ease | ease-in | ease-out | linear */ transition: transform ease-in-out 0.6s; } .page-main img:hover { transform: scale(1.4); } Did you know that 97.4% of home pages have web accessibility failures??? 😱 This finding is one of many from an accessibility analysis that non-profit WebAIM (Web Accessibility in Mind) conducts annually on home pages of the top one million websites.

item.title: Data Analytics 101
item.description: Practical talk highlighting how data can be leveraged to support community-academic partnerships

item.title: Thinking Big with Maps in R
item.description: CANSSI Ontario Statistical Software Conference talk on interactive map-making with large vector data

item.title: Philly Center City District Sips 2022: An Interactive Map
item.description: R-Ladies Philly workshop on webscraping, geocoding, and interactive map-making

item.title: Ten simple rules to host an inclusive conference
item.description: Community-led publication describing ten guidelines for hosting an inclusive conference

item.title: Medication-Wide Association Study Using Electronic Health Record Data of Prescription Medication Exposure and Multifetal Pregnancies: Retrospective Study
item.description: EHR study describing an MWAS approach to explore connections between prescription medication exposure and the risk of multiple gestation pregnancies

item.title: Philly Center City District Sips 2022: An Interactive Map
item.description: An interactive map showing restaurants participating in CCD Sips 2022 & a companion R tutorial on webscraping, geocoding, and map-making

item.title: Exploring Traumatic Brain Injury Mechanisms and Severity Using Electronic Health Records
item.description: Flashtalk and poster presenting preliminary results for a study on TBI among female patients at Penn Medicine

item.title: Design and Evaluation of a Postpartum Depression Ontology
item.description: Study describing an ontology created for the identification of patients with postpartum depression.

item.title: Lessons Learned from the EHR
item.description: Toronto Data Workshop talk about working with Electronic Health Record data

item.title: Hello Umami: Deploying a Privacy-Friendly Open Source Tool for Web Analytics
item.description: A use case for adding Umami web analytics to a blogdown site and deploying using Railway.

item.title: Evaluation of Stillbirth Among Pregnant People With Sickle Cell Trait
item.description: Retrospective cohort study finding both sickle cell trait and disease to be associated with an increased risk of stillbirth, suggesting that sickle cell carriers would benefit from additional risk assessment during pregnancy.

item.title: Harnessing electronic health records to study emerging environmental disasters: a proof of concept with perfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS)
item.description: Proof-of-concept study detailing how Electronic Health Record (EHR) data can be leveraged to study the impacts of environmental disasters like widespread exposure perfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS).

item.title: Professional, Polished, Presentable: Making Great Slides with xaringan
item.description: A useR!2021 tutorial about making great slides with xaringan

item.title: Professional, Polished, Presentable
item.description: Workshop description A three hour intermediate xaringan tutorial created for useR!2021 The xaringan package brings professional, impressive, and visually appealing slides to the powerful R Markdown ecosystem. Through our hands-on tutorial, you will learn how to design highly effective slides that support presentations for teaching and reporting alike. Over three hours, you will learn how to create an accessible baseline design that matches your institution or organization’s style guide.

item.title: Accessibility commitment
item.description: Travel back to the home page, about page, or a11y series of blog posts. Feedback I welcome any feedback on the accessibility of my site and/or the educational materials I create. Please let me know if you encounter any accessibility barriers by using my contact form or mentioning me on Twitter @spcanelon and I’ll do my best to respond promptly. Thank you for visiting my site and for taking the time to read this page

item.title: LICENSE: CC-BY-SA
item.description: My blog posts are released under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

item.title: Hello Hugo Apéro: Converting a Blogdown Site from Hugo Academic
item.description: A tutorial on how to take your personal Hugo Academic/Wowchemy website and convert it to the Hugo Apéro theme

item.title: A Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling Framework for Geospatial Analysis of Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes
item.description: Study describing a Bayesian hierarchichal modeling framework used to explore which neighborhood-level factors and patient-level features were most informative for preterm birth and stillbirth pregnancy outcomes.

item.title: Revealing Room for Improvement in Accessibility within a Social Media Data Visualization Learning Community
item.description: Data visualization accessibility talk to share what we found after scraping alternative (alt) text from data viz shared on Twitter as part of the #TidyTuesday social project.

item.title: TidyTuesdayAltText
item.description: About the data The original data were collected and made available by Tom Mock ( @thomas_mock) using {rtweet}. These data are available in the TidyTuesday repository. These tweets were processed and scraped for alternative text by Silvia Canelón ( @spcanelon) Data were filtered to remove tweets without attached media (e.g. images) Data were supplemented with reply tweets collected using {rtweet}. This was done to identify whether the original tweet or a reply tweet contained an external link (e.

item.title: Individual-Level and Neighborhood-Level Risk Factors for Severe Maternal Morbidity
item.description: Study showing that neighborhood-level risk factors are independent predictors of Severe Maternal Morbidity, providing further evidence that racial disparities in maternal outcomes are symptoms of historical and structural racism.

item.title: The Impact of Sickle Cell Status on Adverse Delivery Outcomes Using Electronic Health Record Data
item.description: Applied Clinical Research Informatics: Solving Real World Problems. Oral Presentations S17: March 23, 2021 11:30am-1pm ET

item.title: Writing Presentations in R
item.description: R-Ladies Seattle package demonstrations showing how to make beautiful slides with xaringan and how to deploy them.

item.title: Deploying xaringan Slides with GitHub Pages
item.description: A ten-step workflow for creating an HTML xaringan slide deck and deploying it to the web using GitHub Pages

item.title: From Learn-R to Teach-R: An Expert Panel on Effective R Instruction
item.description: An R-Ladies Philly panel and discussion event on R instruction and education.

item.title: useR!2021 Cost Conversion Tool
item.description: I created a cost conversion tool used for the useR!2021 Conference to adapt conference and sponsorship fees according to the country of residence. The cost conversion was done according to Gross Domestic Product (GDP) adjusted by Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) provided by the World Bank. We wanted conference attendees and sponsors from different parts of the world to be able to participate in useR! and believed that this is a fair approach.

item.title: Enseñar Tecnología en Comunidad
Introducción al Paquete xaringan
item.description:
Taller del paquete xaringan para presentaciones,
creado para R-Ladies Xalapa

item.title: Not All C-sections Are the Same: Investigating Emergency vs. Elective C-section Deliveries as an Adverse Pregnancy Outcome
item.description: Publication and poster accepted for the 2021 Pacific Biocomputing Symposium. This study utilizes Electronic Health Record (EHR) data to assess the impact of pregnancy-specific maternal morbidity and patient-specific characteristics on experiencing an emergency admission at the time of delivery and its relationship to Cesarean section (C-section) deliveries

item.title: nhsr CSS Theme for xaringan
item.description: Theme In preparation for a xaringan workshop I created for the NHS-R 2020 Conference, I designed a custom CSS theme with input from the NHS-R Community that followed the NHS identity guidelines. This theme was also contributed to the nhsrtheme package developed by Tom Jemmett.

item.title: Development and Evaluation of MADDIE: Method to Acquire Delivery Date Information from Electronic Health Records
item.description: An R algorithm designed to extract delivery episode details from structured Electronic Health Record data.

item.title: Sharing Your Work with xaringan: The Basics and Beyond
item.description: An introduction to xaringan for presentations, created for the NHS-R Community 2020 Virtual Conference

item.title: Sharing Your Work with xaringan
item.description: Workshop description This four-hour hands-on workshop is a gentle introduction to the xaringan package as a tool to create impressive presentation slides that can be deployed to the web for easy sharing. Day 1 covers the nuts and bolts of creating presentation slides using xaringan and deploying them in HTML format for easy sharing with others. Day 2 covers how to take your slides to the next level with the xaringanExtra package and how to customize slides with CSS.

item.title: xaringan CSS Theme for nhsrtheme
item.description: Theme In preparation for a xaringan workshop I created for the NHS-R 2020 Conference, I designed a custom CSS theme with input from the NHS-R Community that followed the NHS identity guidelines. This theme was also contributed to the xaringan package developed by Yihui Xie.

item.title: Becoming certified as an RStudio Tidyverse Instructor
item.description: An overview of the RStudio Instructor certification process and collection of resources to support anyone on their certification journey.

item.title: An Antarctic Tour of the Tidyverse
item.description: An introductory tidyverse tutorial created and presented for R-Ladies Chicago

item.title: Customizing Hugo Academic's Dark Mode with Help from Atom
item.description: Tutorial on how to customize the dark mode in Hugo’s Academic theme with help from the Atom text editor package Pigments.

item.title: Migrating from Trello to Airtable: Working with JSON Data in R
item.description: Tutorial on how to migrate your current Trello board to an Airtable base from start to finish.

item.title: Is Hydroxychloroquine Safe During Pregnancy? Observations from Penn Medicine
item.description: Preprint as a contribution from a rapid response exploration of hydroxychloroquine effects on pregnancy-related outcomes.

item.title: Visualizing the Inside Journey of Recovery from Opioid Use Disorder
item.description: Code for Philly 2020 Opioid Data Hackathon project to better understand recovery from opioid use disorder.

item.title: A Systematic Literature Review of Factors Affecting the Timing of Menarche: The Potential for Climate Change to Impact Women’s Health
item.description: Review paper highlighting how climate change could impact the timing of first menstruation and increase the burden of disease.

item.title: Investigating Pregnancy-Related Health Outcomes Among Patients with Sickle Cell Disease and Linking with Health Disparities
item.description: Poster presented at the 2019 American Medical Informatics Association Annual Symposium held November 16th-20th in Washington D.C.

item.title: Substrate Strain Mitigates Effects of β-Aminopropionitrile-Induced Reduction in Enzymatic Crosslinking
item.description: Research highlighting how the effects of BAPN on type I collagen, produced by osteoblasts, were mitigated by mechanical loading.

item.title: Philly Center City Sips 2019: An Interactive Map
item.description: An interactive map showing restaurants participating in Philly’s Center City District Sips 2019.

item.title: Send me a note
item.description: ** Contact page don’t contain a body, just the front matter above. See form.html in the layouts folder. Formspree requires a (free) account and new form to be set up. The link is made on the final published url in the field: Restrict to Domain. It is possible to register up to 2 emails free and you can select which one you want the forms to go to within Formspree in the Settings tab.

item.title: Characterization of Type I Collagen and Osteoblast Response to Mechanical Loading
item.description: Dissertation completed as part of the requirements for a doctorate degree in Biomedical Engineering.

item.title: β-Aminopropionitrile-Induced Reduction in Enzymatic Crosslinking Causes In Vitro Changes in Collagen Morphology and Molecular Composition
item.description: Publication highlighting how a reduction in enzymatic crosslinking alters type I collagen morphology through an increase in D-spacing.
